description: An unusually late constructed shrine of timber and turf. The shrine had a period of reconstruction in 390 - 400 CE involving the laying of a flint and tile platform.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Great Dunmow (Essex), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Smith, A., (2008), The Fate of Pagan Temples in South-East Britain, in Ritual Landsacpes of South-East Britain
